post.body: So, is zeronet like, 75% Chinese? Should probably start segmenting different websites out for different communities.

comment.body: @Jayq: Infinity next failed, they're still on Infinity, site is somewhat more stable, not much has really changed.

@Jayq: /tech/ is pretty great vs. /g/. GamerGate is pretty much entirely over and few people bring it up anywhere anymore from what I've seen. /pol/ there is more focused, but also overtly "hitler or GTFO", whereas 4pol is more ironic about that. This is important because there is a lot of cross-pollination with 8pol and the other boards, since the whole site is smaller, but /leftypol/ also exists.

@Jayq: (I hate how this uses Enter as submit like Facebook) Anyway, I think 8chan is generally better. Smaller, more focused communities, 4chan has really become too mainstream, more teenagers on there. I have seen /pol/ attitudes in the other boards occasionally, but it's less meme-y, and often correctly called out as off-topic. I do think 8ch runs the risk of getting ICANNed in the near future due to /pol/, whereas 4chan would probably just delete their /pol/ altogether if it came down to it, bigger site would be given some time to react. In which case, that's why we have 0chan.
